meanings.definition: Relating to or situated at the edge or margin of something.
meanings.sent1: The squirrel built its nest in a marginal area of the forest.
meanings.sent2: The flowers grew along the marginal parts of the garden.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to balance on the marginal edge of the table, looking quite silly.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts lingered on the marginal boundaries of reality, lost in imagination.
meanings.sent5: The dim light revealed the marginal shadows cast by the trees.

meanings.sent1: His opinion was only marginal in the decision-making process.
meanings.sent2: The typo in the report was considered marginal and didn't affect the overall message.
meanings.sent3: She made a marginal comment that made everyone chuckle.
meanings.sent4: The old photograph held a marginal significance in her memories.
meanings.sent5: The student's question was marginal to the main topic of the lecture.

meanings.sent1: His work was considered marginal and needed improvement.
meanings.sent2: The soup was only marginal in taste, lacking seasoning.
meanings.sent3: The cat's attempt at catching the mouse was marginal at best.
meanings.sent4: The team's performance was marginal, just enough to pass the test.
meanings.sent5: The repair job was marginal, barely holding the pieces together.
